website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality rugged anchor at a good price, but you might want to switch out the rope for something longer and more durable.
pros: Your choice of red painted galvanized steel or stainless steel (although the latter will cost more)
Comes with 25 feet of rope with a snap hook, marker buoy, and padded nylon storage bag
cons: The line isn't long enough, and some question its durability
Some reports of this option arriving with defects or missing rivets

customer_reviews.title: I believe it should be tied on the front, not the back (my opinion).
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this may be totally my fault but this anchor got stuck the very first time I used it and I had to leave it. I after that happened I looked up some more on these anchors and really you should be tying it to the front of the anchor and using a zip tie to the back so that I doesn't get stuck. I really with there was some instructions and that it was tied this way. I am completely in agreement it is my fault but I think they should add some zip ties and also some instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K. Kress

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after a week in a saltwater environment
customer_reviews.text: The anchor completely fell apart today after about a week of use. Fell apart in 6 pieces as I opened it up on my boat just before deploying. Worthless now and didn't have the time to figure out what went wrong. I immediately grabbed my real Danforth anchor and deployed that instead. Also of note is that the foam floater promptly got ripped apart by the rope as it came set up. You will want to redo the line routing so that it doesn't loop on itself or get a real pvc float. If it hasn't fallen apart, it would have gotten a 4 star rating from me.
customer_reviews.author: Blesum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it today for first time on my kayak, worked great no issues at all 😁 might replace the rope with Paracord as I may need more than 25 feet at certain lakes. Got the bass in the pic while anchored with this anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkel

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I had a feeling this would be a handy addition to my inflatable kayak and I was right. We took our kayak to June Lake and paddled out a ways, then dropped the anchor. The current kind of drew us in a bit until the line went taught, and after that, the anchor dug in enough to keep us in place. We sat in our kayak for quite some time just enjoying the water and the sun, and all the while we remained in place! This will be great if I want to go kayak fishing and stay in place. A great buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Durable and functional
customer_reviews.text: Rating categories are weird for what the item is: Stretch - It’s an anchor. It’s rope. there is no stretch. Light weight - the weight of the anchor is clearly noted. It’s not light or heavy; it’s as marked. Easy to use - yes. It’s an anchor. I used this anchor for beach trips tie down my oversized floats (unicorn, flamingo... you’ve seen them on amazon and other sites for sure...) so you can lie on them and not get carried away by the tide. Works amazingly well for that purpose. Handy float is built in to help highlight the rope in shallow waters. Included carrying case is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well in sand.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Sea-Doo PWC to moor it at the sand bar. I liked the idea because it could fit in my front storage tray. However I had discovered that it does not hold in a sandy bottom unless the water is like glass. I messed with it for twenty minutes trying to make it work with no luck. It won't stay put so I have no use for it. It's also starting to rust on the hinges after being in the water only twice- this is surprising because it's supposedly galvanized underneath. I gave it two stars because the item feels solid and the case it comes with is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Tarbox

customer_reviews.title: WORST ANCHOR EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this anchor and used it for the second time. I anchored it down in light current and less than 30 seconds later it got sucked and stuck in the sand I could not pull it out of the water. I tried for 20 minutes and my kayak almost tipped over. I then cut the rope and let it go. What a waste of money! I’m buying the mushroom anchor next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable anchor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this anchor for my inflatable boat 9’6”. I like this anchor because it comes with a robe, float, and a quick release clamp so you don’t have to buy anything else. The anchor has a good solid paint giving a good rust protection. I used this anchor three times already on different lakes and I’m very satisfied which the product
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kayak anchor
customer_reviews.text: When researching an inflatable kayak, a reviewer recommended buying an anchor. I'm very glad I did. I just spent a day on the Shenandoah River and I was very happy the purchase. This 3.5lb anchor was easy to set and had no problem holding firm in the moving water. It easily stows away in the bag provided. It's sturdy yet light enough to not weigh you down too much when carrying your kayak/canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D.

customer_reviews.title: More suited for pontoon boat, canoe or kayak.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair to anchor up and stop any spinning around by my float tube. Normally boats need one fore and aft. But where is fore and aft on a tube? Outcast's anchor for float tubes, for a pair, was too $$, so I went with these instead. Big mistake as they are OVERKILL. So instead I will use them with my pontoon boat for which they are more suited. These are nice anchors for the money and I might buy another pair as I have a second pontoon boat currently without any anchors. Probably revisit Outcast for their anchors for my tube.
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: Works for the lake
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use floating on the lake with tubes and floats. With the wake coming in from too many speed boats, it's not fun to get beached or worry about floating in when you don't want to. We used this with a few floats attached together. With a lot of wind and boats we did drag a bit, but didn't get beached which is my goal. I can also use it with my paddleboards, kayak and canoe. Just what I need for the #lakelife.
customer_reviews.author: H.F.

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Painted? Yes! Galvanized..... Don't think so. I can see inside where the moving parts meet each other and rust is starting to form after a few outings in freshwater. You're going to have to re-tie the main line to the bottom of the anchor and then run the line up the side of the anchor to the top eye hole and zip tie it. Wish the line was a little longer but it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: hesty24

customer_reviews.title: its ok..sometimes grabs, sometimes doesnt
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, we got this for an Intex 4 Excursion, sometimes itll hold. Other times if the wind is stronger, it will shift the boat down stream. So for a basic anchor. Its better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Werley Family

customer_reviews.title: Rope too short but anchor works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice anchor for my kayak. Only problem I experienced was the rope wasn't long enough. The Reservoir we were fish at was quite deep. I guess I need to get longer rope. Otherwise, it worked very well anchored at the shoreline especially when the wind picked up. I suggest to the seller to offer one with a longer rope.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect heavy duty kayak anchor
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for girlfriends dad. He uses it on his kayak. It's a little larger/heavier then a normal kayak anchor which means you can use it without letting out a lot of rope, or "rode" if you want to get technical, the hextra wieght also helps if its windy. He said it works well, and it has a bag which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S. Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Okay for price
customer_reviews.text: This anchor is okay for the price - I use it with a 2-seat jet ski. It holds well in sand under minimal current. I find even moderate current, however, is too much for it. Stows easily. Only significant problem I've had with it is one time after being anchored for a little while, the snap ring was jammed shut and really took a few minutes of whaling on to get it to open up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor for kayaking!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this anchor once while kayaking. It seems pretty durable and will last a long time, the anchor has a nice red coating that protects its appearance. I like how the anchor comes with a bag to store it on your Yack and improves my fishing experience on my local river, before I focus more on fumbling around with my paddle then fishing, now I can anchor down and relax and fish a spot.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R Nebes

customer_reviews.title: Secure option
customer_reviews.text: These work very well for my kayaks. I have an 8ft, 10ft, and 12ft. Secures any if them with no issues. I have even anchored multiple kayaks with just this one anchor. I did move the tie if lication to the bottom so i dont risk losing the anchor. The paint has come off in a few places which I expected over time just not this early on.
customer_reviews.author: john van hoorn

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a small raft
customer_reviews.text: Have a Seahawk 3 raft , this would not hold my raft on a small lake. Very unhappy with item and returned it. This anchor is too lightweight. Buy bigger or float away...Your choice. I purchased a 12# three claw anchor. Works like it should.
customer_reviews.author: turnitround

customer_reviews.title: it works great for my intex seahawk on lakes
customer_reviews.text: It is great, especially for the price. I bought this because I kept drifting on my inflatable boat and had to row back to position after every cast. I've replaced the 25' line only because I tend to go to lakes with 40+' deep. But I've repurposed the line anyways. Great value, its a huge hunk of metal designed to anchor your small boat, what more can i say
customer_reviews.author: ICEbulrae

customer_reviews.title: Can’t secure it closed
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great value if it performed as it was designed to. The ring that is meant to slide over the grapple fingers to lock it closed won’t reach the locking mechanism. I sent the first order back for a replacement and now I’m sending the second one back for a refund. The second order also has a chip of paint missing, which wouldn’t be a deal breaker since after a few rocky bottom uses would probably happen anyway.
customer_reviews.author: MAN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent holding power
customer_reviews.text: Just used it today for the first time on a 10ft Jon boat. Worked great. Held the boat perfect with 2 grown men and fishing gear. So easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great little anchor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great anchor for river tubes when you are out on a lake! Bought this anchor specifically for kayaking but decided to use it first on my camping trip. What a success! I used it to anchor 4 river tubes at a good distance from the shore of a lake and it was totally worth every penny! I will definitely be using this anchor for every lake trip I take when I take my river tubes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little anchor
customer_reviews.text: This anchor is perfect for holding a kayak in place on ponds while fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest i could find that looked like quality. Came painted in a nice red. Good packaging and the rope is strong. I just used the anchor and made a retractable unit but the rope will come in handy for something.
customer_reviews.author: Cody H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Kayak
customer_reviews.text: We use it on our Kayak when we are fishing. It is easy to clip on and the float is a great addition should you ever forget to clip it. It holds a kayak in reasonable winds without issue. the bag is handy to keep it neat when not using it.
customer_reviews.author: David Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good for SUP
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I need for my SUP. Sometimes the rope is a bit long-I'll drift into the sunlight when I'm parked in the shade, but I just paddle back. I'm also in pretty shallow water-but it's perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: BGG

customer_reviews.title: ... much storage space your kayak has) but it works great. I personally think that
customer_reviews.text: The overall package size (in the kayak) is a little bulky (depending how much storage space your kayak has) but it works great. I personally think that, given this design, the anchor could be much lighter and therefor less expensive, but that's just me. The anchor DOES have an eyelet on the tip of it for an additional rope to pull in case the anchor gets hung up (additional rope not included).
customer_reviews.author: MMDeveloper

customer_reviews.title: Good for SUP!
customer_reviews.text: This anchor worked well for fishing from my stand up paddle board. It was just enough to hold without wind. If a strong wind is blowing you can use it to slowly drift which worked out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Letchworth

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor
customer_reviews.text: Great quality construction. Used today as manufactured but I do plan to reattach the rope as others have suggested with a breakaway zip tie. It was windy and my kayak never moved. I love that it had a bag to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gamage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for river fishing in my Kayak
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona and use this anchor to fish in the Lower Salt River. It is perfect for this application! I tried taking it to a lake but the rope was not long enough. I purchased a separate rope so I can add length for next time.
customer_reviews.author: frigginozzy

customer_reviews.title: Good compact anchor, but wouldnt hold a large fishing kayak in current.
customer_reviews.text: I like this anchor, and think it would typically work well in >25' of water on a regular day. On a day with 20+mph winds this anchor would not hold my 90lb 13' fishing kayak in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S

customer_reviews.title: Not good, for anchoring down a jet sky
customer_reviews.text: Not very good, too light for a jet sky and it doesn't grab to hardly anything
customer_reviews.author: Sargento

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made, and easy to deploy.
customer_reviews.text: This anchor holds my Sea Doo in place even during tidal changes in a pretty dynamic area of Destin, FL. They are easy to store and travel well in the forward storage compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Mick in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Alright anchor
customer_reviews.text: Paint is chipping and anchor is rusting a bit. Using for kayaking and time multiple kayaks together in lakes and rivers. I would recommend a galvanized anchor over this.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Good for PWC. But I don’t recommend for salt water use.
customer_reviews.author: CEG

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today and it's perfect... I don't understand the other complaint about the buoy not being plastic.. because this one it is..
customer_reviews.author: GreatBuyer

customer_reviews.title: A must for doing yoga on a stand up paddleboard.
customer_reviews.text: These are great to have so we can do yoga on our paddleboards. It's lightweight, but does not move even in silted lake bottoms and windy days (10 mph is the max I've experienced so far with 1 foot swells).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works well even for small inflatable boat!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. On a windy day in a ~10 foot inflatable boat with several hundred pounds of gear and people onboard it held us steady. Packs away nicely too. The clip on the end is convenient so you don’t need to mess around with tying knots. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: All Ready
customer_reviews.text: It is rigged and ready in the bag when you get it. You just stow it and use it when you need to anchor. We are using it on our inflatable dinghy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious Design
customer_reviews.text: Locks in both open and closed positions, nice padded storage pouch included. Float was PVC as advertised, rope and spring-loaded clip look to be of good quality. Can’t wait to try it out and will modify my review if performance doesn’t match.
customer_reviews.author: JCity

customer_reviews.title: Great light anchor for a Kayak.
customer_reviews.text: We store this out of the bag it comes in, inside a rear compartment on our kayak. Holds the boat even with a passenger and gear in it. Clips to the rear of the boat, the bouy is a nice back up feature.
customer_reviews.author: QASE

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grappling anchor. I use it for the stern anchor of my Jon boat to keep it from swaying when I use the main anchor. Works well. Fits nicely back into the storage pouch which is padded so it doesn't bang around the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Darkfossit

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works for now
customer_reviews.text: Not made for Salt Water, already starting to rust. I took off the rope provided and used a 1/4" bungie cord for a SeaDoo Spark, works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Audixer

customer_reviews.title: Kayak anchor works great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this product over the last couple weeks on my kayak and it worked as advertised. Love it. Easy to use and compact so easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo 60

customer_reviews.title: Your boat will drift away to gilligans isle
customer_reviews.text: Same your money and buy a real anchor if your in an area when the bottom is slightly hard or is windy - this will not hold.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy T

customer_reviews.title: Great bundle
customer_reviews.text: Just right for my husbands birthday. He has been looking at anchors alone. This will give him everything he needs all in one!
customer_reviews.author: T davis

customer_reviews.title: Looks right
customer_reviews.text: Nice painted anchor, very good quality rope, float, and clasp, and well tied together. Even the carry bag is padded. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RC Pilot

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT KAYAK ANCHOR
customer_reviews.text: Works great anchoring the kayak when out fishing or snorkeling. Appreciate the well made storage bag. The entire set up is top quality and well priced. Much better deal than what was offered at Bass Pro.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE C. BRONSTEIN

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good
customer_reviews.text: As expected and I feel like I got a super good value. We took off the rope and added retractable dog leashes. Never have to wrap rope again.
customer_reviews.author: samcro

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: This item it really nice for the price. Although I don’t know if it will work for any body of water besides a still lake. Deff food got a kayak. Would recommend getting a heavier and bigger size for a canoe
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Lake
customer_reviews.text: We use our anchor everyday in the lake to hold our paddle boards and lake mats in place. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: BD Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor.
customer_reviews.text: Great anchor. Holds together nicely and keeps my kayak in place even in high wind conditions. I use this for fishing in my 13.5' kayak.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Great value and super price.
customer_reviews.text: I love these anchors .I bought two one for each of my boats. easy to use , stores well in its bag and the light weight is great.Being compact allows for more room for other gear in the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second one👍
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson and his new kayak. I have one and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good anchor!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted for my kayak. Good quality and has a good weight to it. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: Good addition when kayaking and to be still fishing or taking pics🚣🏻‍♂️⚓️
customer_reviews.author: Mar R

customer_reviews.title: Basic anchor. Can’t go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drop in the river while kayak fishing. What can I say, it’s an anchor. It does its job. It keeps me in place while pulling in those channel catfish and small mouth bass.
customer_reviews.author: Zak MacKay

customer_reviews.title: Good Kayak Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Holds reasonably well. I wish they offered heavier anchor sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor for SUP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Irocker SUP. works great, easy to use and travel with
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Beckstrom

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: For the compact size and price point this is exactly what I need for my PWC. During ruff wave or other wakes it doesn’t hold sometimes. But for me no big deal and I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Good for my waverunner
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good anchor, holds my wave runner good. I had to add an additional hook on the hook that came with it to make it easier to hook on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Audra Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and compact. Great for watercraft. Use it on the Colorado river. Work great.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN MUELLER

customer_reviews.title: Short
customer_reviews.text: Works well, float attached can get in the way. Rope could be longer
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Me From Getting Carried Away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my kayak, for times when I just want to sit on the water and not be carried off with the tide. Works great, easy to deploy and retrieve, and packs up nicely without taking up too much room on the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Mattatarian

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great anchor for my sup. High quality and works great for floating on my board offshore.
customer_reviews.author: ilovesummer

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: As described. Make sure you get the correct weight for what you are anchoring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: son likes it
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son. Since I don't fish I can't say I personally know anything about it but he told me he liked it. So I guess that means positive.
customer_reviews.author: Robin N.

customer_reviews.title: Kayak only use
customer_reviews.text: Good product for a kayak. Would not recommend for a jet ski
customer_reviews.author: Butters

customer_reviews.title: Kayak anchors for Shoreline fishing!
customer_reviews.text: These come in really handy when I am not trying to move around just throw in the water and tie off!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Goff

customer_reviews.title: No complaints yet!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet but it absolutely holds to its advertisement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check the rope
customer_reviews.text: ad said it came with rope & it did not Sent back
customer_reviews.author: Ron Wedel

customer_reviews.title: Super Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent workmanship, it is indeed a work of art. I bought this anchor to keep a floating raft from moving, it did the job for an entire week the product still looks brand new
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction with a nice carrying bag. I'm loooking forward to using this anchor for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harris-ivey

customer_reviews.title: Drop and Stop
customer_reviews.text: Hold the kayak in place. As soon as you drop this anchor your stationary.
customer_reviews.author: Billsreview

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use, the product quality is a bit poor
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use, the product quality is a bit poor
customer_reviews.author: Sheng

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle Board Anchor!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my paddle board and it worked great! If you like to lay on your paddle board and sun tan or even just not want to paddle anymore this is the anchor for you! Great product for cheap!
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES ELLIOTT

customer_reviews.title: Maybe too small but will be cute fish tank decor
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work ... tried every way possible it won’t work
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Works very well on a kayak
customer_reviews.text: I love this anchor. Works fantastic on my 12' fishing kayak.
customer_reviews.author: BRL82

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. Perfect solution to being blown around in the wind while trying to catch bass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but doesn’t hold
customer_reviews.text: Product is good quality but it doesn’t hold jetski. If you are trying to ancher in ocean water, it wan’t stay stable, I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivana Coteat

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor!
customer_reviews.text: Works great to hold my fishing kayak at 95 pounds and me at 330 pounds in pretty strong current and wind. What else could you ask for!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: it will work fine. I might have to replace the line
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wave runner, and for that, it will work fine. I might have to replace the line, because it's only 25' long. Our lake is over 300' deep in some areas and 86' deep just outside our cove. Easily done.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Fee

customer_reviews.title: Great little anchor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Anchor works great for my seadoo. it surprised me by holding in a sandy area quite well. only reason I didn't give 5 stars was due to the fact a chain should be added to it however this is a great purchase compared to the price seadoo sells theirs for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy Again
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love, not too heavy and rope is perfect extension. Although, the hope is starting to shred and I have used it for only 2 months now. But I would buy again. It does the job, holds my kayak in place and my daughters on the long boards.
customer_reviews.author: Marilen

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very good match for my 13.5' Native kayak. The only adjustment needed was to lessen the length of the rope as I fish saltwater flats.
customer_reviews.author: RBH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect anchor for the kayaks when fishing or for the tubes when relaxing in the water. Easy to transport, and holds well. I like the buoy on the top so I can find it to pull it up easily. It's easy for the kids to use also.
customer_reviews.author: yooperboymom

customer_reviews.title: A new must have in our kayaks!
customer_reviews.text: This anchor worked great - we connected 2 kayaks in the Gulf of Mexico and it held them in place. The anchor set well and stayed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Murdoch

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made, light weight. Haven’t used it yet in the kayak since there’s snow but hopefully soon
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this!!! Such a good deal. We are buying more as gifts for his dad and brother!
customer_reviews.author: Anna D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great in shallow water with sandy bottom
customer_reviews.text: Bought for SeaDoo GTX to use in 3-7 feet of water in bay. Worked great while scalloping last week with 15 knot winds. Swimming down and hand setting the anchor arms into sandy bottom really helps. Not necessary but sometimes the arms don't open up to grab the sandy bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use and does the job well for a two person kayak
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my 2 person kayak. Solid and keeps the kayak still. The only thing to be fixed is the way you tie the anchor. Found this tip on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Ballack

customer_reviews.title: Works as described! Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Perfect for keeping our paddle boards from drifting. We are so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ags

customer_reviews.title: on time shipping .
customer_reviews.text: As advertised looks good will take time to see if it holds-up .
customer_reviews.author: Randall E Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: 1.5 lb anchor holds 2 SUP boards in place effectively in the lake
customer_reviews.author: FOX7373

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I missed the window for returns, so be sure to try it out quickly. You'll find it doesn't work for PWCs, even in sand. It's too light, and the flukes aren't wide enough. Even when I dove down to bury it in the sand, it didn't work. Just an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lambrecht

customer_reviews.title: Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Good price and good little bag to fit everything in
customer_reviews.author: Ozzybar

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We needed an anchor for our jetskii and this gets the job done. Not to mention the quality was great and it even came with a little bag to store away.
customer_reviews.author: Carisaleen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This anchor works great. It is able to hold two paddleboards in place, even on a windy day.
customer_reviews.author: chillamus

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Using on a 12 ft aluminum fishing boat. works for me. I added 4 ft of chain to weigh it down more. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: christian bauwens

product_meta.title: Extreme Max 3006.6548 BoatTector Complete Grapnel Anchor Kit for Small Boats, Kayaks, PWC, Jet Ski, Paddle Boards, etc. -3.5 lbs
product_meta.description: Style:3.5 lbs. - Painted/GalvanizedThe BoatTector 3. 5 lb. Grapnel Anchor Kit is perfect for use with personal watercraft, canoes, kayaks, SUPs or small inflatable boats. Includes folding anchor, 25' rope with plated steel snap hook, marker buoy, and durable padded nylon storage bag. Grapnel anchors hold well in coral, rocky, or heavily weeded bottom conditions and are ideal for short term anchoring. The anchor folds to store easily inside the storage bag alongside the rope and marker buoy.
feature_bullets: Complete PWC anchor kit includes 3. 5 lb. anchor, 25' rope and snap hook, marker buoy and storage bag
Anchor: Folding 3. 5 lb. grapnel anchor with four shanks, ideally suited for use in coral, rocky, or heavily weeded bottom conditions
Rope: 25' hollow braid polythene rope with steel snap hook
Storage Bag: Sturdy nylon storage bag with protective padding
